conclusion: Two particles, A and B, start from rest at the same position and move in the same direction.
The v-t graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis with lines for particles A and B.
Particle A's velocity increases linearly to 2v₀ at time t₀ and decreases back to zero at time 2t₀.
Particle B's velocity increases linearly to v₀ at time 5t₀ and decreases back to zero at time 6t₀.
The area under each graph gives the displacement of the particle at any time.
To find when they meet, find a time where both particles have the same displacement.
Denote the displacement of particle A as s_A and that of particle B as s_B.
Find a time t where s_A = s_B.
For particle A, velocity increases from 0 to 2v₀ from 0 to t₀ and decreases from 2v₀ to 0 from t₀ to 2t₀.
The total time for particle A's cycle is 2t₀.
For particle B, velocity increases from 0 to v₀ from 0 to 5t₀ and decreases from v₀ to 0 from 5t₀ to 6t₀.
The total time for particle B's cycle is 6t₀.
Find the displacement for each particle as a function of time.
For particle A, from t=0 to t=t₀, v_A = (2v₀ / t₀) t.
For particle A, from t=t₀ to t=2t₀, v_A = - (2v₀ / t₀) (t - t₀).
The displacement s_A at any time t can be found by integrating v_A from 0 to t.
For t ≤ t₀, s_A(t) = (v₀ / t₀) t².
For t > t₀, s_A(t) involves integrating from 0 to t₀ and from t₀ to t.
